tutorial.speak:
Welcome to the Assigning Roles tutorial in Chums. This guide will show you how to assign and manage roles for your church staff and volunteers.
To manage roles, navigate to the Settings section in your Chums dashboard.
By default you will open Roles to see all available roles in your system.
To assign a role to someone, click on the role you would like to assign.
Click on the add button in the top right corner.
Type a person's name to add them to the role.
Click add and then save
You can also add a person by leaving the search field open and selecting from the entire data base.
Choose the person you want to assign the role to.
Click Save to assign the role to the person.
To remove a role, click the edit pencil on the right side and choose delete.
You can also create new roles by going to the "+" in the top right corner.
When creating a role, you can set specific permissions and access levels.
Roles can be assigned to multiple people, and people can have multiple roles. You can easily remove someone from a role by clicking the trash can next to their name.
The assigned roles will determine what features and information each person can access in Chums and B1.Church.
